body_html: Yes, this is an unfortunate implementation detail of Defun, which I'm in the process of fixing. We should be able to prune from a function body all stateless nodes that do not influence either a return value or the input to a stateful node. This should apply to Dataset.map() and other Dataset transformations that are parameterized by a function.
body_text: Yes, this is an unfortunate implementation detail of Defun, which I'm in the process of fixing. We should be able to prune from a function body all stateless nodes that do not influence either a return value or the input to a stateful node. This should apply to Dataset.map() and other Dataset transformations that are parameterized by a function.
body: Yes, this is an unfortunate implementation detail of `Defun`, which I'm in the process of fixing. We should be able to prune from a function body all *stateless* nodes that do not influence either a return value or the input to a stateful node. This should apply to `Dataset.map()` and other `Dataset` transformations that are parameterized by a function.
